summary: An Ordinance providing for the improvement of Thirty-eighth Avenue North, in the City of Seattle, from East Prospect Street to East Howe Street, by laying water mains therein or proper dimensions and material, together with all gates, tees, crosses, fire hydrants and other appurtenances necessary for the reasonable water service and fire protection of said avenues, in accordance with Resolution No. 752 of the City Council of the City of Seattle, and providing for the payment therefor by the mode of "Payment by Bonds," as provided by the laws of the State of Washington and the Charter and Ordinances of the City of Seattle
